<div class="headshot2"></div>

<p><strong>Austin Ingersoll</strong><br />
Loan Officer | NMLS #1025119<br /></p>

<img src="https://trello-attachments.s3.amazonaws.com/56d607672efde6f600b49aff/4295x1289/c48aa2aaf66ae287f6b6b38e850625ea/Academy_Logo_Unedited.jpg" alt="Academy Mortgage" style="width: 250px; margin-left:55px" />

<p>
Austin was born in American Fork and graduated from American Fork High in 2002. He is proud to be

from this area and part of this community. He returned home from his mission in 2005 and married his

wife, Andrea, in 2006.  They have two children, one daughter, Allegra Jo, and one son, Archer Ray.

 Austin has been in the finance and real estate industry since 2006.  In 2010, he graduated Magna Cum

Laude from Utah Valley University with a degree in Accounting and Finance.  Since Austin became a loan

originator in 2012, he has held his license with Academy Mortgage, the top producing private lender in

the State of Utah.
</p>


<p>
D | <a href="tel:1-801-901-6203" itemprop="telephone">801-901-6203</a><br />

  <b:widget id='HTML6' locked='false' title='What our happy Utah Valley clients have to say' type='HTML'>
    <b:widget-settings>
      <b:widget-setting name='content'><p><i>"David was recommended to us by our son who lived in the area at the time and when we contacted him, he was confident that he could help us. However, he never gave us false hopes or promises. David was always very professional, but concerned with our needs. I feel that he is my friend. He was always very helpful when I had questions and he took the time to answer them to my satisfaction. I have very much enjoyed working with David and I would recommend him and his team to my family and friends or anyone who is looking to sell their home.</i></p>

<p><b>- Jan Yamamoto</b></p>

----

<p><i>"David and his team were knowledgeable, capable and focused, and they did not disappoint throughout the entire process.  I was glad I had David and his extensive experience on my side and I came to trust his judgment, decisions and advice.  He and his team helped me through several challenges unique to my property, advised me with the utmost expertise on several difficult issues which if handled improperly could have stopped or prolonged the process, and worked tirelessly and promptly on all fronts to drive the process as quickly and efficiently as possible.  If you are considering the sale of your property, do yourself a favor and get David and his team in your corner."</i></p>

<p><b>- Ryan Prows</b></p>

entry.title: What Makes Now Such a Great Time to Sell?
entry.content:
What's going on in the south Utah market? We've got an update on a few key areas for you today.

Buying a home? Click here to perform full home search
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

Today we've got a quick update on the South Utah County market.

Currently in [Salem ?] there are 49 active homes, 29 of which are either to-be-builds or under construction, so there's not much inventory. Moving to [Elkridge ?], which is booming right now, there are 66 homes on the market. Similarly, 56 of them are to-be-builds or under construction.

Moving to [Pacen??], there's less inventory. We have just 25 active homes on the market with 19 residential lots available. Moving south to [Sanaquin??], there are 41 homes on the market. Like the other areas, most of them are either under construction or to-be-builds. In [Genola??], there are just four homes on the market.

There's not much inventory out there, but there will be a ton of growth over the next 20 years. Now's a great time to sell your house because you can get so much equity out of your home. Recently, I've helped a few sellers list their houses and they've been able to get a lot of equity in a short amount of time because of low inventory. 

Now is a great time to sell your house and get a lot of equity quickly.
It allows sellers to put that money into their business or simply pursue things that they want to pursue. If you have the option to sell your house, it's an amazing opportunity because of all the buyer demand.

If you have any questions or you're thinking about selling your house in the south Utah market, don't hesitate to give us a call or send us an email. We'd love to help you!

entry.title: Have You Met New Agent Daniel Pust?
entry.content:
The experience of a failed home sale inspired Daniel Pust to become an agent himself and join us at the Canovo Group. Were glad he did.

Buying a home? Click here to perform full home search
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

Today its my pleasure to introduce you to one of the new agents on our team, Daniel Pust.

Daniel is happily married with a young son in 1st grade. He grew up in the Santaquin/Payson area and still lives there because he loves it. He worked in law enforcement for seven years and eventually became a detective before transitioning into real estate. 

Ironically enough, he came into his new profession through a failed transaction, which inspired him to educate himself about our line of work. When he bought his first home in 2004, the market was so hot he hardly remembers even talking to his agent at the time. Three years later, he and his wife had built up quite a bit of equity in that home, and when they found their dream home up in the Santaquin mountains, they decided they wanted to buy it. 

Unfortunately, the two agents who worked on that transaction didnt know what they were doing and it cost them that home purchase. That experience inspired Daniel to take it upon himself to treat his clients with professionalism, stay on top of whats going on, and provide them with whatever they need, whether theyre buying a home or selling one. 

Daniel chose Keller Williams because of the education we provide. As a detective, his job was very demanding, and KW offered training sessions that were compatible with his schedule. He also credits his mentor for taking time out of her busy schedule and encouraging him to stay involved. He ended up here at the Canovo Group through knowing someone who also worked here whose life was transformed positively because of the experience. Working with fellow agents Dane Hill and Ali Garbero on a transaction, which he describes as an amazing experience, also sealed the deal. 

Daniels goal is to establish our brand in South Utah County. He works hard every day and has run into quite a few people who want to move but havent put much thought in how theyre going to do it. He enjoys being able to provide a resource for them. Daniel is a person who has both his clients', friends', and family's best interests at heart. Hes full of integrity and will do the right thing regardless of how it impacts him and his business. 

Daniel always has his clients best interests at heart.

Were certainly excited to have him on our team. If youd like to contact him, you can reach him at (801) 850-5656. If you have any other questions, feel free to give me a call or send me an email. We look forward to serving you in the future!

link.title: Have You Met New Agent Daniel Pust?

entry.title: Has the Utah Real Estate Market Improved over Last Year?
entry.content:
A lot can happen in a year. Heres how our real estate market has changed from 2016.

Buying a home? Click here to perform full home search
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

The first quarter of the year has nearly come and gone, so I wanted to show you some of the most recent numbers from the Utah market and compare them to what we saw in the first quarter of 2016.

The average days on market for homes listed for sale stayed pretty steady. We went from an average of 33 days in 2016 to an average of 34 days in 2017. Homes are still selling really fast. Home sales have gone down from 6,300 at this point last year to just 6,000 this year. However, inventory is down by around 10% too.

Finally, lets talk about home appreciation. It seems to be the one thing everyone asks about. To determine this, well look at the median sale price in our market. At this point in 2016, it was $230,000. There has been a significant jump since, and the median sale price in our market right now is $251,000.

As we have predicted in the past, the market remains strong. As long as rates remain relatively low, well continue to see this trend and we will see anywhere from 4% to 7% appreciation again this year. Some of the top economists in the country have made predictions on the higher end of that spectrum.

As long as rates stay low, our market will continue its rise.

If you are thinking about taking advantage of current market conditions by buying or selling a home, give me a call or send me an email. I would love to hear from you.

link.title: Has the Utah Real Estate Market Improved over Last Year?

entry.title: Buying Just Got Easier With the NHF Sapphire Program
entry.content:
The NHF Sapphire Program can help buyers finally purchase their dream home. Heres how.

Buying a home? Click here to perform full home search
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation


Today, a good friend of mine and my preferred lender, Austin Ingersoll with Academy Mortgage[sp?], is joining me to have a chat about a new program that just became available for buyers in our market.

Its called the NHF Sapphire Program and its a true grant program, which means you dont have to repay the funds that are given to you. You can use the program for a VA, USDA, or an FHA loan.

Depending on your credit score, you can get all the way up to 4.5% of your loan amount given to you. To put that into perspective, on a $300,000 loan, thats $13,500 which can be used for your down payment and closing costs.

As far as requirements go for qualifying, they mirror the loan you are applying for whether its an FHA, VA, or a USDA loan. However, to get the most out of this program, you want to have a credit score of at least 680, but you can go as low as 620.



This program can help get buyers off the sidelines and into their new homes.



All in all this program is great for buyers out there who are sitting on the sidelines because they may think they dont have enough money for a down payment.

To see if you qualify for this program or if you have any other real estate questions, give me a call or send me an email. I would be more than happy to help.

entry.title: Why Should You Sell This Winter?
entry.content:
We are asked this question every year around this time. So, is it smart to sell now or should you wait until spring to list?

Buying a home? Click here to perform full home search
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

Every year around this time, were asked the same thing by sellers: Should I sell my home now or wait until spring? Many of our clients are thinking of hunkering down, waiting out the winter, and selling in the spring. I want to give you four reasons why you might want to consider selling now versus waiting until spring to do so.

1. More competition during the spring. That means less competition right now. While many people have the same thought process as most of our clients and are waiting until spring, you can get a jump on the competition by selling now and taking advantage of the low inventory.

2. Interest rates may be higher in the spring. Right now, rates are near all-time lows. With the election passing and the Federal Reserve saying they wont be making any adjustments in the near future, thats good news for buyers right now. If rates do tick up a bit this spring, it will eliminate a lot of buyers in the market and diminish the purchasing power of many others.

3. A lot of job transfers happen at the beginning of the year. A lot of these people are looking for homes as we speak. This is just another segment of buyers you wont be able to capture in the spring and summer.

4. More serious buyers. If youre a buyer out looking for homes during the cold, snowy winter months, there is a good reason for doing so. These buyers are likely motivated to get into a home as soon as possible.



These are just a few reasons to consider selling now.


These are just four of the reasons why you should consider selling now to take advantage of the market. If you have any questions for us or are thinking about selling, give us a call or send us an email. Wed be happy to help you!

link.title: Why Should You Sell This Winter?

entry.title: How Can You Keep Your Home Safe During Your Holiday Vacation?
entry.content:
If youre planning a vacation during this upcoming holiday season, there are five tips you should follow to keep your home safe while youre away.

Buying a home? Click here to perform full home search
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

The holidays are just around the corner, which means you may have a fun family vacation in the works. Here are five tips to keep your home safe while youre away:

1. Get a Wi-Fi doorbell. If you dont already have an alarm system installed in your home, you might want to consider this. How does it work? The doorbell is connected to your smartphone, so anytime someone rings the doorbell, you will be able to see who it is and respond accordingly. 

2. Add some exterior lighting. If you have areas around your property that are dark, you may want to consider installing new lighting fixtures or just double-check that the bulbs in the existing light fixtures work. To go a step further, you may want to also consider installing a motion sensor light. 



Extra lighting is an excellent deterrent for potential intruders.



3. Let a trusted neighbor know that youll be gone. Tell them when youre leaving and when youre coming back so they can keep an eye on things. 

4. Adjust delivery of your mail and newspapers. If youre still one of those people that receives a newspaper, you want to make sure those arent accumulating atop your driveway. Thats a surefire indicator to any watchful intruder that nobodys home. Ditto for mail overflowing out of your mailbox or packages piling up on your front steps. 

5. Double-check that all doors and windows are locked. According to Safewise.com, 30% of all home invasions happen through an unforced entry. This means almost a full third of every home invasion occurs because someone forgot to lock a window or door. Before you leave, check one last time that everything is locked. 

 If you have any questions about whats going on in the market or youre curious about your homes value, dont hesitate to give us a call or send us an email. We hope to talk to you soon!

link.title: How Can You Keep Your Home Safe During Your Holiday Vacation?

entry.title: Every Great Seller's Market Has Its End
entry.content:
Conditions in the Utah Valley real estate market are perfect for sellers. However, the days of low inventory and quick sales are nearing their end.

Buying a home? Click here to perform full home search
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

There has been a lot of discussion about the great appreciation and quick home sales weve been experiencing in our market lately. No one knows for sure how long this will last, but we do know that markets always shift. It has happened in the past and it will happen again.

Ive got some strategies to share today that are quite useful in a shifting market. Pricing your home is one of the most important aspects of your sale. Here are some strategies that we share with our sellers on how to price appropriately in a shifting market. 

In an appreciating market, you usually see low inventory and high demand. This is what drives prices up. Sellers have the luxury of pricing ahead in this type of market. As long as the market continues in an upward trend, they will get their price. 

Things are different in a depreciating market. When supply goes up and demand drops, home prices come back down. If you try to price ahead in a depreciating market, you may find yourself chasing that market down and you may never get your price.



Pricing ahead in a depreciating market can be toxic.



We like to consult our clients about whats happening in the market right now and we are in a funny place today. We have seen a lot of sellers get away with pricing ahead, but that is a recipe for disaster if we start to shift to a depreciating market.

 If you have any questions about how to price your home appropriately in a shifting market, give us a call or send us an email. We look forward to hearing from you!

link.title: Every Great Seller's Market Has Its End

entry.title: How Much Has Our Market Changed in a Year?
entry.content:
A lot has changed in our market over the course of a year. Even though home sales are down in total numbers, they are selling in a much shorter timespan.

Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation

We are diving deep into the numbers today. The statistics are in for the third quarter of this year, and were going to compare them to the numbers we saw at the same time last year. 

In the 3rd quarter of 2015, we saw 16,023 homes listed on the market. This year, we saw 16,606 homes listed in the same time frame. Thats an increase of nearly 4%, which hasnt happened in a while.

As for home sales, the 3rd quarter of 2015 saw 12,661 homes sell. This year, that number was 12,156. This is about a 4% decrease. Inventory is going up and sales are going down. I think this is something we really need to keep an eye on because it may be an indication that things are starting to change in our market.



We need to keep an eye on how things progress.



The next thing we want to focus on is the days on market. We saw a huge 38% drop from 2015 to 2016. In the 3rd quarter of 2015, the average days on market was 24. At the end of the 3rd quarter this year, that number was at 15. I didnt think homes could sell any faster than they did last year, but I was wrong. Homes that are priced right and in good condition are selling within weeks and sometimes even within days.

Finally, lets talk about home appreciation. At the end of the 3rd quarter in 2015, our median home price was $230,000. This year, that number is at $250,000. This 8.7% increase is even more good news for sellers.

We are seeing fantastic conditions for sellers right now, but how long is it going to last? No one knows for sure. What we do know, however, is that increased appreciation and such few days on market is a great recipe for seller success.

entry.title: Tips for Buying and Listing a Home at the Same Time
entry.content:
Is it really better to find the home you plan on buying first, or should you sell your current home before you start looking at other properties?

This is the main question I get from clients who are looking to buy and sell at the same time. Most clients want to find the home they are going to purchase before they even list their current property. They dont want to sell their current home and then get left high and dry; they want to make the transition from the sale of their current home to the new one as smooth as possible by only moving once.

When a client waits to list their home until they find the home they want to purchase, it can become a very frustrating experience. Here is what happens:

You decided to wait to list your home but start searching the market. Our buyer specialist then finds you the perfect home for your family. You want to write an offer but, since your current home isnt even on the market yet, that offer is subject to the sale of your existing home.

The problem with that situation is we are in a sellers market. Generally, if a home is priced right and in good condition, someone else will fall in love with that property, too. Buyers often end up competing. If the seller gets your offer and its subject to the sale of your home, you may end up having a seller reject your offer. The seller may tell you to come back when your current home is under contract, but in the meantime, the seller will continue to market the home to other buyers.
In other words, making your offer subject to the sale of your current home could mean losing out on your dream home because you are in a poor position to negotiate with the seller.
Instead of making a contingent offer, attack both angles with a more effective strategy. Go ahead and start looking for that perfect home, but put your current home on the market at the same time. We will work to generate an offer on your home so that when you go to make an offer on your dream home, the seller will be more willing to accept your offer.



List your current home and generate offers while you look at new homes.



If you havent found a new home yet and you receive an offer on a current home, you can make the sale subject to you finding a replacement home within a certain period of time. This strategy makes the entire process easier and keeps you in a strong negotiating position.

As you can see, the process of buying and selling a home at the same time can be a little complex. Please dont hesitate to call me with any questions you may have. I would be happy to help you!

link.title: Tips for Buying and Listing a Home at the Same Time

entry.title: 3 Home Staging Secrets for Utah Sellers
entry.content:
Buying a home? Click here to perform full home search
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

The point of staging your home is to make it look open, clean, and inviting to potential buyers. You want to make your home stand apart from others on the market, and you can do this in three different ways.

  1. The 50% Rule: This means that you should eliminate 50% of everything in your home. When youre preparing to move out of your home, its a good opportunity to get rid of what you dont need. Either donate it, put it in storage, or toss it. This goes for furniture, decor, and everything else.

  1. The Basketball Rule: Eliminate anything smaller than the size of a basketball. Small objects can make a room feel cramped and compact, so get rid of picture frames, books, knickknacks, and other things that are smaller than the size of a basketball.

  1. Bare Countertops Rule: Clearing off your countertops is an essential part of making your home feel larger and more open. Whatever you have laying around on your countertops, get rid of it. Youll thank us later.


If youd like a copy of our 67-point Home Staging Checklist, please dont hesitate to reach out to us. Its a great time to get your home ready to sell!

Are pre-sale inspections a good idea or a bad idea? Can they help you save money? Whats the deal?

This is where a lot of sellers lose money or even their buyers. For instance, if youve accepted an offer, many buyers add a contingency in the contract, which includes a home inspection. If the inspection comes back with items of concern, thats another area a buyer can negotiate with you. They might not only want you to fix these repairs but bring down the price of their offer. It might even deter buyers to withdraw their offer entirely.

Dont let this happen to you! We want to put you in charge as a seller. Theres a simple way to take control of the situation before you even list your property in Utah.

By conducting a pre-sale inspection, you remove inspection-related contingencies from the contract. This benefits you because it no longer becomes something to negotiate with the buyer. You additionally have the opportunity to repair those problem areas before you even list your property on the market. We want you to be comfortable and confident that issues wont arise after youve listed your home.

entry.title: Whats the Secret to Finding the True Value of Your Utah Home?
entry.content:
Buying a home? Click here to perform full home search
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

When determining the sales price for your Utah home, its crucial to do your homework. Many agents in our market today dont take the time and effort that they should in helping their clients determine the proper sales price for their home. Oftentimes, an agent gets a call from a friend or family member asking them if theyll list their home; the agent usually takes the time to pull up a few comparable properties, but not much else. They then come up with a sales price based solely on the comparables without even stepping foot in the home! 

Here at the Canovo Group, we go far more in depth to determine a list price for our clients. When we have a client who is looking to sell, the first thing we do is a rough estimate. This is a basic analysis used to determine what price range you can expect to sell your home in; the purpose of this is to give you some information to go off of to start making some basic decisions about whether you even want to move forward with the sale of your home.

If your home falls in a price range that makes sense for you, and you want to pursue it further, we will then schedule a walkthrough appointment of your home. During it, we will take notes and snap some pictures in order to become familiar with your property. We want to understand the condition, the fixtures, the finishes -- the unique selling features of your home. We want to experience all this for ourselves so we can determine what makes your home unique and figure out how we can leverage those features to sell your home quickly and for top dollar.

Once this part of the process is down, we head back to the office in order to do a full, in-depth equity evaluation. From there, we will develop a comprehensive selling strategy for you. Over the last 12 years of selling real estate, we have devised a very specific selling system to help us identify the optimal sales price for you. We want to avoid leaving money on the table, but we also want to avoid overpricing your home and having it sit on the market for months with no interest.


Were going to do our due diligence and take some time to really make sure that weve done our job to ensure that were helping you make a decision on where you price your home to get top dollar and sell it quickly. So, make sure you do your homework before you put a price on your home! A good agent will walk you through the entire process I just described, so it doesnt need to be a stressful or difficult experience!

If you have any questions about this topic or about real estate in general, please dont hesitate to reach out to us. We would love to hear from you!

link.title: Whats the Secret to Finding the True Value of Your Utah Home?

When youre getting ready to sell and figuring out where to price, one thing you want to avoid is relying on third-party data, like a Zillow Zestimate or other automated home valuation sites. This information can give you a misunderstanding about what your home value is.


We recently heard of a new agent in the business who was using tax data to determine the value of a home they were selling. The value they came up with was drastically below market value, and was a steal for the buyer that gobbled it up. Zillows Zestimate is pretty inaccurate, as they dont take into account any upgrades or improvements made on your house.

What you really need to price your home correctly is a great agent who knows what they are doing when it comes to pricing. Someone who can use current market data and facts to help determine your homes true value.

entry.title: What Do Recent Market Trends Mean for You?
entry.content:
Buying a home? Click here to perform full home search
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

Has our market improved since this time last year? This is a question we get all the time, and one we seek to answer here today.

The first thing to take a look at is days on market, the number of days a home typically sits on the market before being sold. For 2015, the average days on market is 28 days, year to date. This same time last year, homes were sitting on the market for about 46 days. That's a 40% decrease in the number of days on market, so homes are selling a lot faster than they did last year.


Sales are up 16% this year as compared to last year, from roughly 31,000 last year to about 36,000 this year, year to date. The one stat everyone wants to know is where the median home price is compared to last year, and we have good news. The median sales price has increased 6% as compared to this same time last year, from $215,000 to $227,900 in 2015. The number of listed homes throughout the year is basically the exact same, as we had 52,500 this year and 52,300 in 2014.

Homes are selling quickly, prices are going up, and inventory has remained steady, making this an awfully healthy market. Combine this information with low interest rates and things are looking great for Utah real estate. If you want to take advantage of these fantastic conditions, or if you have any real estate questions of any kind, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. We would love to hear from you!

link.title: What Do Recent Market Trends Mean for You?

entry.title: Short Sales vs. Foreclosures
entry.content:
Buying a home? Click here to perform full home search
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation 
Call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation

What is a short sale? While that question is not as common today as it was a few years ago, short sales are still an option for homeowners who want to avoid a foreclosure.

A short sale is when a lender agrees to sell a property for less than what is actually owed to them. If you have a mortgage on your home and you owe the lender $300,000, but you can only get $250,000 for the home and the lender agrees to accept that amount, it would be considered a short sale.


Now, a short sale in the eyes of a homeowner is often a tool used to avoid a foreclosure. There are generally three repercussions of foreclosure that homeowners need to be aware of if they are in a financially stressful situation and need to avoid foreclosure: credit damage, deficiency judgement, and tax liability.

A short sale is not a perfect solution, but it is a tool homeowners can use to minimize the damage.

If you have questions about a short sale, or want to know if a short sale would be right for your specific situation, give me a call. I would be happy to help you!

entry.title: Four Expert Tips to Price Your Home for Top Dollar in a Sale

Buying a home? Click here to perform full home search
Selling a home? Click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation

I have a very surprising statistic to share with you today. Did you know that the average real estate agent in our MLS only gets a client 84% of their original asking price! That means if you list for $300,000, you're getting $48,000 less than you expect. Our group gets our clients - on average - 98% of their asking price. Today we'll be speaking about how you can price your home for top dollar through four different steps.
  1. The Rough Analysis: This is where we determine a potential price range that your home would be able to sell in. This gives you the opportunity to decide whether you want to sell based on the price range that we give to you.
  2. A Walk-Through of Your Home: During this process, we will take pictures and identify unique selling features, as well as denote areas of improvement that can be made to put more equity in your pocket. We want to familiarize ourselves with your property during this step.
  3. Research and Analysis: This is when we come back to our office and really study the market to find an attractive price for your home. We come up with an optimal price for your home so that we can sell it for top dollar and also in a short amount of time. We don't want your home to sit on the market, we want it to sell as fast as possible.
  4. Pricing Consultation: After we've done all the necessary research, we will bring you into our office and prepare the information for you. We will take into account the goals that you have for your home sale, and advise you on how you can best reach those goals. We want you to make the final decision, so this will be a consultative process, and we will not push you to make a decision one way or another. 
This is the process that we use to get our clients 98% of their asking price. We utilize research and identify your specific needs to price your home correctly so that it sells for top dollar. 

If you have any questions about this process, or if you would like to speak with us about selling your home in Utah this spring, please don't hesitate to contact me. I'm always here to help you!

entry.title: How Will a Changing Utah Market Affect You in 2015?
entry.content:
There are many great Utah homes for sale. Click here to perform full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Today, we're going to take a look back at 2014 and discuss some of the trends we saw in Utah real estate. Then, we'll determine what it all means for our market moving forward.

Last year, the market slowed down a bit when compared to 2013, where we saw around 12% appreciation. Much of the growth we saw in 2013 was a result of a recovering market trying to make up for the ground lost in the recession. It's actually good news that 2014 saw appreciation rates fall to around 5% - it's simply unsustainable to have rates over 10% year over year. 

Homes were staying on the market longer in 2014 than they did in 2013; homes stayed on the market for an average of only 29 days in 2013, but that number grew to an average of 43 days in 2014. Despite the fact that it took longer to sell last year, anywhere between an average of 40 and 60 days on market is a fantastic place to be. It means homes are still selling quickly, especially when they are in good condition and priced right. 

Overall, the market slowed down last year. However, it was a healthy slowdown - you don't want to see skyrocketing home prices year after year. The goal is to maintain gradual growth, as anywhere between 4% and 7% appreciation is a great place to be.

What does all of this mean going forward, and what can we expect in 2015?

This year, we're predicting to see more of the gradual growth we saw in 2014. As long as interest rates remain at their current low levels and they don't spike significantly at some point this year, we're going to continue to see high buyer demand, widely available loan programs, and a steady pace of home sales. 

As you know, real estate is very local and every neighborhood is different.

If you have questions about conditions in your area, or would like to know what the future might look like for your specific market, don't hesitate to give us a call or shoot us a quick email. We would love to hear from you!

entry.title: Why Should You Consider Investing in Real Estate?
entry.content:
There are many great Utah homes for sale. Click here to perform full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Today, we want to do something different. We interviewed our investment property specialist Dane Hill here at the Canovo Group. He specializes in identifying investment properties for our clients and was kind enough to answer a few of our questions.

Why should someone consider investing in real estate?
"It's one of the safest and most effective ways to build your wealth. Real estate is a perfect investment because it's a multifaceted investment. You get your returns in a lot of different ways -  through taxes, appreciation, and rental income. Some of the best returns to be had in this, or any other, market is in real estate. It's a hard asset that everyone needs; no matter what happens with the economy, people always need a place to live."

Is it difficult to get started investing in real estate? 
"Real estate can be intimidating, but it's not difficult once you get into it. It's one of those things where you just have to do it. If you have a great team and are working with good people who can walk you through the process, it makes the decisions easy and something you're excited to do."

Is there anything else our viewers should know about investing in real estate?
"The most important thing people need to consider, especially if they haven't invested in real estate in the past, is some of the best investors I've worked with are ones who understand that there is no better time to invest in real estate than right now. Building wealth in real estate is a Tortoise and the Hare type thing - you want to be the tortoise. The investment is slow and consistent, you're not waiting on the market and trying to hit it big at the right time. You take it slow by investing consistently over a long period of time. That's the way you're going to get the best returns and be able to walk away with a large investment portfolio that pays you great returns."

We want to thank Dane for sharing some of this fantastic information with us - we hope you found it helpful. If you have any questions about investment properties, or need any real estate assistance of any kind, don't hesitate to give us a call or shoot us an email. We would love to give you access to the resources you need to make intelligent real estate decisions!

entry.title: Should you Wait Until Spring to Sell?
entry.content:
There are many great Utah homes for sale. Click here to perform full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Should you Wait Until Spring to Sell?

We are here today to talk to you about a common question that we get this time of year. That question: "Should I list my home for sale on the market now, or wait until spring?"

This is a common question because there is a misconception out there that selling in the winter brings you less money for your home than you would get in the spring and summer.

The reality is this: Although there are more home buyers in the summer, and more sales activity in the summer, it doesn't necessarily translate to higher prices on the market. If you are considering selling now, these 2 pieces of information might help you make up your mind.

1. Buyers are motivated
The buyers that are looking for homes this time of year are motivated .Usually because they have to buy before the end of the year, whether that is due to relocation or tax purposes. These are serious buyers, who are looking for seriously good homes.

2. Less competition
During the winter months, there are far less homes for sale on the market. With less competition, your home can more easily stand out from the crowd. Lower inventory means more demand for your home. 

If you have any questions about what is going on in your neighborhood, we would be glad to talk with you and see what we can do.

link.title: Should you Wait Until Spring to Sell?

entry.title: Orem Utah Real Estate
entry.content:
There are many great Utah homes for sale. Click here to perform full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Why Real Estate is the Best Investment

There are a lot of different kinds of investments out there you can make. Whether it be in the stock market or in start-up companies, there are a lot of different ways to make money. Investing in real estate is one way to make money, and we have 5 reasons for you why real estate property is the best investment you will ever make.

1. When you are investing in real estate, you are a direct investor.
You control your own destiny, picking your own properties and how you make money off of them. When you are putting your money in the hands of somebody else, it's harder for you to trust them and easier for them to misuse your money when it's not their own.

2. You have a tangible asset that has universal need.
No matter what happens in the economy, people are always going to need a place to live. By investing in real estate, you are providing people with homes that will always be in demand. 

3. Real estate is a multifaceted investment.
You aren't just putting all your eggs in one basket with real estate investment. You can get return from multiple avenues, including a 4-5% a year appreciation, cash flow, and great tax advantages on top of that.

4. You can leverage your investments.
By leveraging your investments, you can multiply your returns

5. Real estate investments can be low hassle with high returns.
Most people think that investing in real estate will have them out at 2am, unclogging toilets and fixing leaky roofs. But when you structure your property and its lease right, and have the right contractors and property manager, your investment can be worry free.

If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us. We would be glad to answer them.

entry.title: Utah Real Estate Market Update for Fall 2014
entry.content:
There are many great Utah homes for sale. Click here to perform full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Utah Real Estate Market Update for Fall 2014

We have a fresh market update for you today, catching you up on all the latest happenings in real estate. For this update, we will be examining the health of the market by comparing this year's 3rd quarter numbers to that of last years. As  you will see, the subtle changes have made our market a lot healthier in the process.

The average days on market, or how long it takes for an average home to sell, has risen by 46% in the past year, from 28 to 46 days. While it is taking longer for homes to sell, the average of 46 days is still a historically low average. Homes aren't flying off the shelves as quickly and that helps to stabilize the market a little bit. 


Median sale prices have risen slightly compared to last year. While it was only a 2.8% appreciation, from $211,000 to $217,000, the fact that the appreciation rate has slowed down a bit is a good sign for the future. When appreciation happens too quickly, the market becomes less stable and becomes more difficult to navigate.

Inventory also decreased slightly when compared with last year. We are down a little over 2% this quarter as compared to the 3rd quarter of last year.

All of these signs point to us to having a very good market out here in Utah. Prices slowed down their increase and unemployment rates still remain low, which are both really good signs for the health of our market. 

If you have any questions about the market or how to take advantage of it, give us a call or send us an email. We'd love to help out!

link.title: Utah Real Estate Market Update for Fall 2014

entry.title: 3 Simple Rules to Sell Your Home for More
entry.content:
There are many great Utah homes for sale. Click here to perform full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (801)214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

3 Simple Rules to Sell Your Home for More

We are going to talk to you today about what it takes to get your home prepared to sell. There are some specific rules things that you should be doing so you can get the maximum value for your home. Most of our sellers don't go far enough in preparing their home for sale. We really want you to stretch yourself to maximize the amount of money you put in your pocket. 

We have a 67 point checklist that we provide all our clients with that walks them through every little thing they should be doing to their home to prepare it for sale. If you'd like a free copy of the guide, just give us a call or send us an email. We'd be glad to send one out to you, free of charge. 

Today we are going to focus on 3 of those 67 points. These 3 rules have to deal with preparing your home for sale and staging it for open houses and photographs. These are rules we follow with all our listings and we have had great success with them. Here are the rules:

1. The 50% rule
This one may sound simple and cheesy, but it has a huge impact. The rule is simple: remove 50% of everything that is in your home. When you do this, it's going to have a significant impact on the look and feel of your home. It might feel bare, but a potential buyer will see open spaces and will be able to better visualize themselves living in your home. 

2. The basketball rule
This one is also simple, yet effective. Remove everything in your home that is smaller than a basketball. Get it out of sight. Things like books, picture frames, and other home decor need to go. Removing these items will make the space more open and clean. 

3. Bare countertops
When we professionally photograph and stage homes, we absolutely want the counter to be bare. It definitely affects how the home does online. It makes a big impression.

Following these 3 rules along with our 67 point checklist, you are well on your way to maximizing your home's value. IF you have any other questions, please feel free to give us a call. We'd be glad to help.

link.title: 3 Simple Rules to Sell Your Home for More

What many people don't realize is that they have the option to dispute their valuation. If you think the valuation is too high, you can appeal the value. We are going to give you a link to do so right on our page. This link will lead you to instructions on how to dispute your tax valuation.

The Robinson Report | 2nd Quarter 2014 Market Update

With the release of the 2nd quarter numbers for this year, we thought we would compare where we are now to where we were at this point in 2013. Here are the numbers:
  • Days on market has risen 5%, from 24 to 37 days.
  • Home sales have dropped 4%
  • Median sales price is only up around 2.9%
While these numbers may look bad, it's important to keep them in context. Last year was a booming year in real estate - the number of homes sold skyrocketed by 20% over 2012. We also saw median sales price jump 15% last year. The slowdown we are seeing now was expected, as last years numbers were quite atypical.

All in all, we have a healthy market that for obvious reasons isn't matching last year's numbers. As you know, real estate is local - conditions change depending on the area you live in. If you have any questions about your specific market, or are interested in buying or selling, don't hesitate to give us a call or shoot us an email. We would love to give you a hand.

entry.title: Utah County Real Estate Market Update for 2013
entry.content:
There are many great Utah homes for sale. Click here to perform full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (801) 214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Utah County Real Estate Market Update for 2013

Hey there, we are here today with a quick market update for you regarding the numbers we saw in 2013. We are going to look at 3 key categories where we saw major shifts in 2013. 

1. Days on Market
  The days on market, or the number of days homes stayed on the market before they actually sold, was down in 2013. In 2012, the average was 51 days. In 2013, that average dropped to only 33 days, a 35% decrease. Homes sold very quickly last year and it will be interesting to see if that trend continues in 2014

2. Units Sold
  The number of units sold in the state of Utah was up greatly last year. We went from 32,000 sold in 2012 to 35,500 sold in 2013.

3. Median Sales Price
 This is the figure that got us really excited. In 2012, the median sales price for a home in Utah was $180,000. In 2013, that figure skyrocketed to $205,0000. 

So all in all, it was an amazing year for Utah real estate and 2014 looks like it will be a great year as well. If you or somebody you know is looking to buy or sell real estate in Utah, please let us know. We can help them take advantage of the price increases in the market to get the most out of their real estate transaction.

link.title: Utah County Real Estate Market Update for 2013

entry.title: Should you sell now or wait?
entry.content:
There are many great Utah homes for sale. Click here to perform full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (801) 214-1662 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.


Should you sell now or wait?

  In the winter, the dilemma is always deciding whether you should list your home now, or wait until spring to do so. Today we are going to talk about the top 5 reasons you may want to consider selling your home now instead of waiting until spring.

1. Becoming a Non-Contingent Buyer
 One of the biggest struggles sellers have when they are looking for a new home is that they have their old one to sell. You're not in a very strong position when you make an offer contingent upon the sale of your current residence. By selling now, and potentially renting, it gives you an opportunity to be in a strong position and get a better price.

2. January Job Transfers
 January is traditionally the time when most job transfers take place. Many of those individuals will be looking for a home to buy in January. With a lot of building going on in north Utah County, many of those employees moving into the area are going to be looking for homes for sale in the winter.

3. Tax Purposes
 Some buyers need to buy before the end of the year for tax purposes. They meet with their accountants and decide it makes sense for them to purchase now so they can take advantage of tax breaks at the end of the fiscal year. 

4. Inventory is Down
 There is much less competition in the market for your home, meaning you will fetch a much higher price.

5. Emotional Buyers
 Especially during the Christmas season, buyers are emotional. When you have an emotional buyer, they will probably be willing to pay more for your home than they otherwise would.

That's all we have for today. Be sure to give us a call if you have any questions on this topic or any questions about real estate in general. We'd be glad to help you out.

link.title: Should you sell now or wait?

entry.title: Salt Lake and Utah Counties- 3rd Quarter Market Update
entry.content:
Watch on your mobile device >>


One of the best ways to determine where we are headed in real estate is to take a look at where we have
been. And looking at the numbers coming in for the third quarter of 2012, there is a lot of good news to report!

Median Sales Price
The median sales price for Salt Lake County has gone up 5.4%, a welcome occurrence particularly since we 
have been working toward recovery after the housing market crash of 2007. In Utah County, the median
sales price increased even more to 6.7% higher than the same time last year.

Average Days On Market
In terms of the number of days it takes to sell a property, the average DOM for Salt Lake County has gone
down a very significant 52%! This indicates a very fast-moving market with homes selling over 50% faster
than they were just a year ago. In Utah County there was also an improvement in Days on Market with a
39% change for the better.

Home Sales
The number of homes that have sold through the third quarter of 2012 as compared to the same time
frame last year has gone up 15% in Salt Lake County and 8.8% in Utah County.

Number of Homes Available
Inventory levels have been fairly stable with a slight decline in both Salt Lake and Utah Counties. The 
number of available homes on the market for Salt Lake County went down 1.5% this time of year versus
last and there was a 1.8% decline in inventory levels for Utah County.

~
If you are thinking about selling a home or buying a new one, I invite you to get in touch with me so we
can discuss your real estate needs. Since real estate can fluctuate from one neighborhood to another, the
statistics reported here may not accurately reflect your particular market environment. I would be happy
to do a home value analysis for you to provide an accurate picture of what you can expect for your home
in todays market.

For buyers, this is an excellent time to buy given the phenomenal interest rates available right now. At
record setting industry lows, you can lock in a rate that will put more money in your pocket month after
month, for years to come.

Contact me today at 801-836-6950 or david@davidrobinson.com.
